Question: The government should increase tariffs on products imported into the country
Comment: I strongly support imposing stiff penalties on countries like China, Russia, South Korea and Vietnam to prevent them from illegally dumping steel and aluminum into the U.S. and throughout the world. Yet, "it simply makes no sense to start a trade war with Canada, the European Union and others who are engaged in fair trade, are not cheating and where workers are paid a living wage with good benefits."

Question: Current taxes on the rich are too low and should be increased
Comment: Substantially increase the top marginal tax rate on income above $10 million.

Question: We should reduce taxes on the middle class
Comment: People who have health care under Medicare for all will have no premiums, no deductibles, no co-payments, no out-of-pocket expenses. Yes, they will pay more in taxes but less in health care for what they get.

Question: The government should address reducing the national debt through higher taxes or reduced spending
Comment: I believe that we should be asking the very wealthiest people in this country to start paying their fair share of taxes.  That way, we will not only lower the deficit but we will bring in enough revenue to invest in our economy and create the millions of new jobs we desperately need.

Question: The government should support (through grants, tax breaks, subsidies) the clean energy sector
Comment: Supports the Green New Deal, which calls for government support to transition the United States to use 100% renewable, zero-emission energy sources

Question: The government should break up the mega-tech firms (Alphabet, Facebook, Amazon) into smaller competing firms
Comment: Asked on Capitol Hill by POLITICO whether he backed such calls for antitrust action against the social networking company, Sanders replied, “The answer is yes of course.”

Question: I support a public single-payer healthcare system
Comment: Section 107 of Sanders's bill outlaws “private health insurer to sell health insurance coverage that duplicates the benefits provided under this Act"

Question: Higher education should be tuition free (publically funded)
Comment: Pass the College for All Act to provide at least $48 billion per year to eliminate tuition and fees at four-year public colleges and universities, tribal colleges, community colleges, trade schools, and apprenticeship programs. Everyone deserves the right to a good higher education if they choose to pursue it, no matter their income.

Question: The government should forgive outstanding student debt
Comment: Cancel the entire $1.6 trillion in outstanding student debt for the 45 million borrowers who are weighed down by the crushing burden of student debt. This will save around $3,000 a year for the average student loan borrower.

Question: The government should introduce a gun buy-back program
Comment: Voluntary buybacks may be one option to remove from society those weapons already in private hands.

Question: Death penalty should be ended at state and federal levels
Comment: Abolish the death penalty

Question: Government should allow clemency plans for non-violent drug offenders currently incarcerated
Comment: No data

Question: Marijuana should be legalized at the state and federal levels
Comment: Legalize and erase marijuana convictions

Question: The government should provide all women free access to abortion facilities and cover costs of care
Comment: Abortion is healthcare

Question: Citizens united should be overturned
Comment: We must repeal Citizens United, move to public funding of elections and end voter suppression and gerrymandering.

Question: President should be required to come to Congress for an authorization of the use of military force (AUMF)
Comment: Allow Congress to reassert its Constitutional role in warmaking, so that no president can wage unauthorized and unconstitutional interventions overseas

Question: Israel meets international standards of human rights
Comment: Israel Should Be Condemned For Killing Unarmed Protesters

Question: We should bring U.S. troops home from America's post-9/11 wars without delay
Comment: I would withdraw U.S. military forces from Afghanistan as expeditiously as possible

Question: Illegal immigration is a major national security problem in the US
Comment: If you open the borders, my God, there's a lot of poverty in this world, and you're going to have people from all over the world. And I don't think that's something that we can do at this point.

Question: Growing defense / pentagon spending should be a priority
Comment: We're going to invest in affordable housing, we're going to invest in public education, we're going to invest in rebuilding our crumbling infrastructure — not more nuclear weapons and never-ending wars.

Question: US and developing countries (China, India) should have same climate change standards despite the underlying different stages of development
Comment: Pass a Green New Deal to save American families money and generate millions of jobs by transforming our energy system away from fossil fuels to 100% energy efficiency and sustainable energy.
